SEARCH
Package cards

Class Deck

java.lang.Object
cards.Deck
public class Deck extends Object
Represents a deck of cards. Each deck consists of an ArrayList of cards. The first value represents the state of the card (-1 = face down, 1 = face up). The second value represents the suit of the card (1 = Spades, 2 = Hearts, 3 = Clubs, 4 = Diamonds). The third value represents the value of the card (1 = Ace, 2-10 = the numeric value, 11 = Jack, 12 = Queen, 13 = King, 20 = Joker).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Deck()
    Creates a standard 52-card deck with all cards face up and no jokers.

    Creates an empty deck.

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the deck contains no cards.
      Returns:
      true if the deck has no cards, false otherwise.

      Overrides the current deck, replacing it with a standard 52 card deck.

      public void flipDeck()

    • flipDeckOrder

      public void flipDeckOrder()
      Flips the order of every card in the deck. Does not change the state of any cards.

    • displayCard

      public String displayCard(int index)
      Returns the card as a String.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the card to be displayed.
      Returns:
      the String representation of the card. If the card is face down it only returns that it is face down.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.
